item.title: 007 First Light delayed to May 27, 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

No longer due out on March 27, 2026.

IO Interactive has delayed 007 First Light from its previously planned March 27, 2026 release date to May 27, 2026. It will be available for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store.

Here is the full message from IO Interactive on the delay:

Hello everyone,

Today, we are sharing an update regarding 007 First Light, as we have decided to move the game’s release by two months, to May 27, 2026.

007 First Light is our most ambitious project to date, and the team has been fully focused on delivering an unforgettable James Bond experience, bringing together breathtaking action, globe-trotting, spycraft, gadgets, car chases, and more. As an independent developer and publisher, this decision allows us to ensure the experience meets the level of quality you players deserve on day one.

The game is progressing well and is fully playable from beginning to end, so these additional two months will allow us to further polish and refine the experience, ensuring we deliver the strongest possible version at launch. We’re confident this sets 007 First Light up for long-term success, and we sincerely appreciate the patience and continued support we’ve received ever since we revealed the game. We look forward to sharing more updates regarding 007 First Light in early 2026.

Thank you again for your support,
IO Interactive

item.title: KANADE now available for Switch in Japan
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

Visual novel first released for PC.

A Switch version of visual novel KANADE is now available for Switch via Nintendo eShop in Japan at a launch discount price of 1,584 yen, publisher Good Smile Company and developer Frontwing announced. It supports English, Japanese, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese language options.

KANADE first launched for PC via Steam on June 12.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

KANADE is a visual novel planned and penned by Asou Ei, with character designs and illustrations by Yusano.

Enjoy the romantic story of two former pen pals as they experience their first love in a world that is gradually approaching its demise.

Story

In the near future, a sudden proliferation of plants has left much of human civilization drowning in greenery. Yuuto is a boy living in a city that’s now largely reclaimed by nature. One day, a girl named Kanade appears on his doorstep.

The two had been exchanging letters after she found one of his carrier pigeons.

“I have to sing the greatest love song and save the world in my mother’s place.

So, Yuuto-san… Would you please fall in love with me?”

Warmly watched over by those around them, the two tentatively begin their exploration of love. What neither of them realize is that a spark of affection has already budded between them…

Fall in love, make music, and save the world.

This is the tale of a wondrous future where the encounter between a boy and girl brings a miracle to the world.

Main Character

  • Kanade (voiced by Yuko Natsuyoshi) – A half-human, half-alien girl who loves to sing. She hopes to save the world through song in place of her alien mother, who isn’t there to do it anymore. Honest, kind-hearted, and always polite, she puts her all into everything she does. However, her unfamiliarity with Earth as a half-alien sometimes shows itself in ways that surprise those around her.

Key Features

  • A script planned and written by the prolific Asou Ei (euphoria, Kuroinu, and Sakura no Uta), who previously penned Lilja and Natsuka: Painting Lies with Frontwing.
  • A story that is accessible for new visual novel players.
  • Character designs and illustrations by Yusano, who had also worked on ATRI: My Dear Moments and GINKA among other games.
  • A heroine voiced by Yuko Natsuyoshi (Rio, Shine Post anime; Yuyu, Assault Lily anime), who also sings the opening theme of the game!
  • A soundtrack by industry veteran Fuminori Matsumoto (Wonderful Everyday Down the Rabbit-Hole).
  • An opening theme with lyrics by Yoshikazu Kuwashima, known for his work on vocal tracks for the Grisaia series.
  • 1920×1080 resolution support.
